revised_title: Sulphocyanic Ethers Isomeric Transformations and Mustard-Oil Reactions
tldr: The author investigates the isomeric transformations of ethylic mustard-oil and sulphocyanide of ethyl, examining their reactions with hydrogen, water, and hydrochloric acid. The study reveals the formation of various compounds, including ethylamine, methyl-ethylamine, and sulphuretted hydrogen, providing insights into the chemical properties and reactions of these compounds.
